data.title: Overrated
data.text: This used to be the "go to"'place about 20 years ago. Oxnard has so much better food now. And Tdm needs to know they have competition. There breakfast is good especially their frijoles and papas. And love their horchata. But the meat is so dry and tasteless it's not even grilled it's more like steamed. And if you go in the morning the food is last nights leftovers . And the place it's self is a dump! Just because it's not the best part of town doesn't mean the inside needs to look like a dump. After all these years the owners don't have money to remodel?

data.title: Dive taco place
data.text: Pretty well known by locals.  Open late.  Very reasonable prices.  Tacos, burritos, and some other usual suspects.  Burritos were excellent.

data.title: Fast Food For Mexicans Food Lovers
data.text: I will only buy take out. Equal to the popular mobil catering trucks which can be seen in most Hispanic areas now a days. limited English speaking, but they try to understand what you want to order. Once upon a time many moons ago, this is what you would only get from a food street vendor cart.

data.title: Staple of the 'Nard
data.text:
That's what locals call it. When I lived in the area for a few years, this was one of the recommended places to eat at. I would make beelines here during lunch to buy food. Just recently, got the chance to go back, so I had to get me a torta again. While I took it to go, it was bomb to eat, even better than the recent torta that I had at King Torta in LA. I know that if I eat this too much, it won't be good for me, so I savored this one. The dude that worked there was cool and hooked up a special chicken taco for me, as I mentioned that I hadn't been there in awhile. 

I wish I tried the other TDMs in the area, but this one has never let me down.

data.title: Great Tacos & Burritos
data.text: This is the go to spot for me and my workers when we have a craving for Taco's or burritos, these are authentic. The staff here do speak enough English for a non Spanish speaking person to order, Love the Asada Meat, We only get  take out so the ambiance or any lack of there is not important it's the taste and quality which is  what we want. Tried the other locations different owners and they do not meet this place on 5th street and Meta as to the taste.

data.title: OLD SCHOOL MEXICAN!!!!!!!!!!!
data.text:
place has been here forever!!!!!!!!!!!!!
im not a fan much of their meats, but their sauce and portion sizes are pretty big.  their guacamole is FANTASTIC! Service is ok.  prices are low. their nachos are very good.  they use monterey jack cheese.  they are open very late.  old area. 
their jamaica is very good.  beans are full flavor!

data.title: Value for $$$
data.text: As noted below, this place is a little controversial. For arguments sake, I am reviewing the TDM on 5th St and Meta in downtown Oxnard. There are other branches that may or may not be operated by the same people in Oxnard and Ventura. This place has authentic Mexican-style tacos and burritos to eat there or take out. The standards for neatness and cleanliness are basic; that being said, I have never had a problem with the quality of food here. I have always gone for lunch; I do not recommend going for a midnight snack. The portions are large; the burritos are HUGE! You better be hungry. You can order almost any combination of ingredients you can imagine in one of these. They basic burrito comes with beans and rice, then whatever kind of meat you wish: carne asada, carnitas, chicken or some other things you will not be familiar with unless you have lived out in the country on a farm. They are particularly good at breakfast; I recommend nopalitos with scrambled eggs as a hangover remedy. There are two kinds of salsa: hot and hotter.

data.title: I won't go back and I am Mexican!
data.text: The location of this restaurant is not a good place to take your family. I am not a fearful person but I do know the area. Not good. The food was so-so but the place is a dump. It's dirty, broken chairs, missing chairs, dirty windows and no one seems to care. I will not be back. Now it's time to go home and make my own homemade tortillas!

data.title: The burritos are okay...
data.text: There are several "El Tacos de Mexico"  in Ox-ball...  The best one is Jessie's on 7th street.  Back in the 90's there was just the one and the Al Pastor tacos where the best in the region. Things are a little different these days but a Al Pastor chili relleno burrito is still pretty killer if your not afraid of a little heart burn.

data.title: My absolute favorite!!!
data.text: My family and I have been eating here since I was a baby and I still love this restaurant the best! I have traveled all around the world while in the military and I still carve the food at TDM!!! I have been getting the carne asada burrito for years and have always been impressed! The customer service is awesome! I don't live in Oxnard anymore but whenever I come home to visit my family the first stop is always TDM! My dad is an absolute regular and they always know what he wants before he even puts in his order! And to clear up a reviewers comment below, I have never in the twenty some years I have been going here ever felt there was any kind of prejudice against me or my family (we are white). I have never witnessed it or believe that actually happened. They are always kind and cheerful. They are hard working and care about the quality of their product. I go to the one on Saviers almost ways but have tried the other one and its just as great! If you roll through Oxnard defiantly make a stop here! Even if there is a line trust me its worth the wait!

data.title: Horrible Customer Service
data.text: Where do I start…. Taco De Mexico does serve good authentic Mexican food, but there customer service and responsibility towards the patrons is hilarious. They are prejudice to others who are not of Mexican decent and will argue with you when they know they have done wrong. Example; I always order Chili Relleno and rice burritos when I go there for lunch or dinner, and many, many times I have done this in the past. It is always the same lady taking the orders, day, night, weekends, it doesn’t matter…. she must be the owner or something of that level. Today I order and I get two Chili Verdi burritos. I tell her and she tells me how wrong I am no matter what I tell her and even raises her voice. Funny thing is she knows me because  I frequent the place often. Taco De Mexico at one time would always be packed, but now I understand why. They have alienated non-ancestry humans from there establishment, and have over priced there food. One thing good about Oxnard, you can always get high quality Mexican food around almost every corner…. “SEE YA” Taco De Mexico, I’m not ever going back.

data.title: Authentic
data.text: This place always has lines, the food is good and plentiful.  Expect to wait for at least 10 minutes before you order.  Its greasy, its filled with people, and these is little room to sit but the food is so good.  Take the food out and head down 5th street to the beach for a picnic.

data.title: Excellent food!
data.text: Some times there is a line out the door, but don't be discouraged... they are fast and the food is definitely worth it.  The carne asada burritos are delicious!  Just remember to ask for extra salsa on the side.

data.title: Locals Eat Here (enough said)
data.text:
cheap n cheerful, busy taqueria with screaming kids, tattoo'd macho guys, hungry teens, food lovers all.  Order at the counter from large selection of tacos, burritos, tostadas, flautas, etc and wait for your number.  Sit at uncomfortable plastic seats under fluorescent lights... but it's all part of the authentic Oxnard Latino scene.  You're there for the food.  

Enormous taco salads, tasty distinctive meats, heavenly horchata (cinnamon rice milk).

data.title: Only eaten at the So. Oxnard, Saviers Rd. location
data.text: Mostly I get the food to go but on occasion when too hungry to wait have eaten here.  I have never been treated rudely and I am a gringa, although I speak ok Spanish.  The food is very good.  I love soft tacos asada.  My one son also goes here when he visits as he feels their food is the best Mexican food.  For his birthday, his brother actually brought him one of TDM's huge burritos.  He lives about 1.5 hours east of us so sure it was cold but I'm positive he gave it a nuke later and thoroughly enjoyed it.  Not fancy inside but ok.

data.title: Authentic Mexican Food North of There Border
data.text: Well I have traveled from TJ to Cabo on 2 and 4 wheels. All 1080+ miles. You won’t get tacos on a spigot from Taco Day’s but they just about have everything else. Nothing and I mean nothing like there Chili Renello and rice burrito with mild sauce…. Hold the frijoles and cilantro for me that’s for sure.

data.title: Oxnard staple
data.text: This is probably the most popular mexican resraurant in oxnard. Its really good food MOST of the time, however on occasion they have been known to serve meat that did not seem very fresh. Personally not my first choice for a burrito, but then again my favorite spot is not open at 1am and this place is. The 5th st. and the 7th st. locations anyway. The saviers one closes early, but I prefer the other locations anyway

data.title: Great, cheap Mexican food
data.text: I eat at the one on Saviers all the time, since I work near there.  I'm Anglo and have never had the slightest problem with attitude or service.  My favorite is "Tacos de Papas" delicious mashed potatoes in 3 crispy tortillas with all the crema, onions, lettuce and salsa they can fit.  Maybe if you don't go looking for attitude, you don't find it.

data.title: ::::::warning::::: avoid if you're anglo
data.text:
great food here but go at your own risk if you're you're anything but spanish-speaking mexican. i'm half spanish so i can pass but i see white people getting harrassed or insulted or even pushed around all the time even when they are being totally cool.  it's too bad because tdm is the best food in town. the workers should just get a clue and treat everybody the same.  guess they have to be proud of race since the way they treat people is nothing to be proud of.

sorry, i love the food, but i had to speak up.  ~ reina

data.title: the one on Telegraph though...in Ventura.
data.text: the one on Telegraph though...in Ventura.
